result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristine A Lieven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall not possess/consume any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant shall not associate with any known drug users or dealers or be in any place where drugs are illegally purchased/sold/consumed.

Defendant shall not enter establishments whose primary purpose is the sale/service of alcohol.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed and only as prescribed.

Defendant shall provide proof of any prescription medication to her probation agent and shall notify her agent of any change in prescription medication within 48 hrs.

Def enters guilty plea.  Court finds def guilty and orders presentence investigation.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Gary R Schmaus.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Defendant missed court as was unsure of court date and had contacted counsel but did not receive a call back and did receive an offer letter and mother passed away two months ago and has been hectic and was an oversight and then turned herself in this a.m. after making contact with attorneys office and advised had missed court.  Defendant is having lots of health issues.  State advises an offer has been provided and request small cash amount as is defendant's second non-appearance, counsel states first non-appearance was because defendant did not receive the summons.  Court orders $250.00 cash bond.  Court does not address prior signature bond.  Arraignment scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
